content.description: Start sitting on the boulder just below the arete. Match on the blocky jug and then move to a gaston right. Head straight up to the ledges. Top out by the sapling. Great holds, overhanging with a spicy topout!
content.protection: Couple pads at least. Three or more ideal. The landing isn’t great but protectable. Spotter recommended.
content.location: Left of Ancient Futures at the arete just before you can drop down between the two giant boulders.

content.description: Start on the left trending crack and top out is the same as for Easy Beaver. This serves as the best downclimb off of the second boulder.
content.location: Crack to the right of Easy Beaver.

content.description: Sit start with right hand in the "hole" and left hand pinching the flake between the two aretes. Work your way straight up, between those same two aretes. Topout to the right of that tree. I just down climbed and jumped to the pad instead of going all the way up.
content.location: Same start location as Span the gap, but starts a bit lower.

content.description: Sort of a stand start with Left hand up high on the top of the large flake between the two aretes. Right hand on the undercling/jug. Figure out the moves to span the large gap into "Evil Beaver (EB)". Finish as for "EB"
content.location: Start position is in description. Crux is spanning the gap and making the transition right into EB

content.description: Start as you would for Beaver Crack but head straight up the left crack instead of going right. Mossy and leafy up top. Highball.
content.location: Left of Beaver Crack.

content.description: Start low in the wide crack. Good big jugs help you top out. Perhaps it could be protected with gear.
content.protection: A couple pads and highball head.
content.location: Large obvious crack located between the two big boulders.

content.description: Sit start on the sloping rail filled with skin ripping quartz crystals, move up to a good jug and swing around to mantle up and top out. Stay true to the overhung arete for the true route.
content.protection: A pad on the rock behind you if slip off
content.location: On the right corner of the larger of the two blocks.

content.description: Start sitting matched on a good jug under the overhang. Move up and left toping out as you would for Mushroom Cap Crack. Beware one flake is fragile, use the top right section or it might blow off.
content.location: Right of Evil Beaver and left of Bosquitos.

content.description: Start standing on two flake jugs. Move up and right into the finger crack.  Follow the crack for a few moves until you can pull the lip.
content.location: On the overhung portion of the boulder. Just after Beaver Crack. Looking at the route there’s a slope on the left down to a small stream.

content.description: Start just to the right of a small tree growing from the boulder. Follow the low angle face and crack to the top. Crux moves are low. Big holds up top makes this a secure climb. Tree is off.
content.location: On the backside of the boulder with Ancient Futures. Look for the quartz dike and small tree growing on the boulder.

content.description: Would be better if the chockstone at the lip wasn’t there. I guess it also makes the route a bit spicier. Start sitting under the overhang left hand on the sloping feature and right hand on a crimp. Move up on great holds until you can reach the chockstone and pull the lip. Top is still a bit dirty.
content.location: On the overhanging side of one of the big boulders. Right of Beaver Crack and left of Mushroom Cap Crack.

content.description: Start on the lowest jug and head up the Arete on good holds. Serves as a good down climb or to get on the boulder to check out the top.
content.location: On the Arete to the right of Bosquitos.

content.description: Climb the slab behind "Overdose". Easier moves lead to more excitement at the top! Stay to the right of the little tree growing in the center of the face. Avoid using the arete out right to bail. The climb goes straight up to the top.
content.protection: Just send it. Falling is not really an option....
content.location: On the large boulder directly behind "Overdose"

content.description: Begin with sharp underclings, trend left to a decent if sharp hold.  Now work your way right, find the crimps and top out.
content.location: The problem is located to the left of overbite.  It begins to the right of a large square block on the right boulder.

content.description: Start matched on the big undercling. Head up and left to the good crimp rail over the block. Up and over the small bulge on crimps. Forget about the landing and finish the crux mantle to the top.
content.protection: Two or three pads. One for on top of the block.
content.location: Left of Ancient Futures. Climbs over the flat block.

content.description: Sit start with hands over head. Heel hook and move straight up to top out.
content.location: On the left side of the the 2nd boulder. Also best descent.

content.description: Start matched on the lip. Throw a heel and work the holds left to the top out for Overbite.
content.location: Lip to the right of Overbite.

content.description: Start at the base of the right arching crack on the backside of the boulder with "Bosquitos". There is a low start but I started standing and worked the crack to the top. See beta photo for start hold I used.
content.protection: Pads. Landing is sloped a bit.
content.location: Backside of the boulder with "Bosquitos". Obvious right arching crack. There is also a badass vertical crack to the left of it that can be climbed but the start contains mucho porcupine poop.

content.description: Start the same as "Overbite". Instead of trending up the arete, stay left and work the crimps on the face to the slopey topout.
content.protection: Decent landing over the start. Boulder sits behind the top-out so you'll need a pad/good spotter for that.
content.location: Same start as "Overbite"

content.description: This route is named after the book Ancient Futures. The book discusses how globalization affects culture change throughout the world with emphasis on maintaining an ecological balance between humans and the environment.  Sit start on two crimps and make your way up to a gaston. From there, use a variety of holds to top out. There are multiple betas to gain the gaston. Either use an undercling, or use very sharp crimps. Your choice.
content.location: Starts next to the block on the left. Stay away from the rail and sidepull up and left. I dont think they would make it any easier anyway.

content.description: Start as for Evil Beaver and link that into Mushroom Cap Crack. This is definitely a long pumpy route.
content.location: Start as for Evil Beaver just keep going with the crack that trends right.

content.description: The better boulders in this area. There are two main blocks in this area with some fun easy/moderate climbing and what looks like there could be some seriously hard stuff.
